file_content.text: Hey, sis. Knew you wouldn't forget about me. Who's the cloudhead?
The captain Darmas asked us to help. What happened when you followed Skavak? How come the Justicars snagged you?
Saw something I wasn't supposed to. You won't believe this, but I caught the Justicars trading supplies with the Empire.
I killed some Imperials getting you free.
That fits with what I know.
I appreciate that. They weren't very nice to me.
That's a strange friendship.
Some turfers think a few Imperials stayed behind after the war ended. I always thought it was just stories to scare the kids.
All I care about is getting my hands on Skavak.
What about Skavak?
Oh, yeah. Almost forgot about him, what with the beatings and torture....
Skavak and the Imperials were laughing about something. Not sure what. The Imperials took Skavak into the Works.
The Works, huh? Then that's where I'm going, too.
Finally!
Are you crazy, cloudhead? That place is like instant death.
I've never heard of this place. What's it like?
Tell me about the Works.
It's a big mess of power stations and old factories below us. I didn't think anything could survive down there except droids.
I'm not buying this.
Listen hard and wise up. My brother is telling you the solid truth. Why would he make up something like that?
If Skavak dropped to the Works, you may as well go home. You wouldn't last five minutes.
We're pretty good. Bet we last ten minutes.
The Works is nothing but toxic ruins and berserk droids. People who go down there don't come back.
Skavak stole my ship, and I'm not letting him get away.
Doesn't scare me.
That ship must be something if you're willing to die over it.
If Skavak and the Imperials can survive down there, so can I.
Skavak went there.
You're a lot braver than I thought. Or dumber.
I'll come back.
Been nice knowing you, I guess.
I'd like to go home, now. This is the worst party I've ever been to.
Jiik, remember the tunnel we found? Crawl in and come to the warehouse. I'll hide you from the Justicars.
Great. I'm gonna smell like rancor droppings for a week. Thanks for busting me out, Captain.
You're hurt pretty bad, Jiik. Sure you can make it?
You seem a little wobbly.
I've been beat up a lot worse than this. Well, not really... but I'll be alright.
You did good, kid.
No problem.
Kid? I'm almost as old as you....
Get out of here before I start shooting again.
Run for your life.
You got it. I've risked my life enough for one day.
Jiik, take my holotransmitter from the captain before you leave. I'm not letting you out of my sight.
Don't be so dramatic. It was only a little torture.
Good luck down in the Works, Captain. You'll need it.
You smell just like I feel.
I smell like sweet freedom, kid.
Don't knock it.
Freedom smells like a herd of dead banthas? Learn something new every day.
I... I feel like my insides are coming out.
On your feet, Jiik. Let's get you out of here.
Your sister sent me.
Heh. You're definitely not a Justicar. All they ever called me was "gutter scum."
If you plan to throw up, do it away from me.
Are you gonna be sick?
Nothing left in my stomach. Justicars were hard on my appetite.
Tell me where to find Skavak! Now!
I need information. Talk!
Ska... Skavak? Who are you?
Captain, he's just a kid. Give him a break.
Jiik? It's me, Juul. Are you alright? What did those Justicars do to you?
You're making things up.
